properties.name: Gyeonghui Palace (경희궁)
properties.description: Posted by Discoveringkorea Gyeonghui Palace (경희궁), which is also known as Gyeongdeok Palace is one of the "Five Grand Palaces" of Korea\'s Joseon Dynasty (1392-1910) and is located in downtown Seoul.

properties.name: Gyeongpo Beach
properties.description: Posted by Discoveringkorea Gyeongpo Beach is a popular white sand beach in Gangneung, in Gangwon Province.

properties.name: Gyeongpodae Pavilion (경포대)
properties.description: Posted by Discoveringkorea Gyeongpodae Pavilion (경포대) overlooks the Gangneung Lagoon. It has lovely views of the area and is popular among couples.

properties.name: Jongmyo (종묘) Royal Ancestral Shrine
properties.description: Posted by Discoveringkorea Jongmyo (종묘) is the royal ancestral shrine of the Joseon Dynasty. In keeping with the tenets of Confucianism, the spirit tablets of ancient Korea’s kings and queens are enshrined and memorial rites are performed here.

properties.name: Naksan Temple (낙산사)
properties.description: Posted by Discoveringkorea Naksan Temple is built on a beautiful bluff overlooking the East Sea. Although it was mostly destroyed by fire, many of the main buildings have been rebuilt and trees replanted. A great place to view the sunrise.

properties.name: Ojukheon (오죽헌)
properties.description: Posted by Discoveringkorea Ojukheon (오죽헌) was the home of Lady Shin Saimdang and Yul Gok, two of Korea\'s most famous cultural figures.

properties.name: Outer Seorak Mountain
properties.description: Posted by Discoveringkorea Rising 1,708 meters but within eyeshot of the beach, Seorak Mountain is one of Korea\'s most popular national parks and its only UNESCO conservation area. Each year, millions of visitors view the mountain’s famous craggy peaks and spectacular fall foliage.

properties.name: Seongyojang (선교장)
properties.description: Posted by Discoveringkorea Seongyojang (선교장) was built in 1703 by an 11th-generation descendent of a Korean prince. For 300 years the home was passed down through an aristocratic family. Today, it\'s open to the public.

properties.name: Seonyu Island (선유도)
properties.description: Posted by Discoveringkorea Seonyu Island is an eco-consciousness park in the middle of the Han River in bustling Seoul.

properties.name: Sokcho Beach
properties.description: Posted by Discoveringkorea Sokcho Beach is located about 500 meters from the Sokcho train station.

properties.name: The House of Sharing
properties.description: Posted by Discoveringkorea The House of Sharing is a home for the elderly survivors of Japanese sexual enslavement during World War II. It also includes the Museum of Sexual Slavery by the Japanese Military.
